hackathon-description-text: CUHacking is the first Major League Hacking membered hackathon in Ottawa, and expected to be the largest hackathon in Ottawa. CUHacking will bring students across several cities, and a wide range of disciplines and skillsets together to learn something new by working on creative software or hardware projects.

hackathon-judges.judge-role: Professor - Carleton University Department of Systems and Computer Engineering

hackathon-rules:
Participants must follow Major League Hacking's 
.

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: MLH will be awarding swag bags to each member of the team with the best domain name from Domain.com.
MLH will be awarding Amazon gift cards to each member of the team that makes the best use of AWS.
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Amazon Web Services - Best Use of AWS

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Use your tech skills for good and hack online harassment! Build a software solution that can help reduce the frequency and/or severity of online harassment. Members of the winning team receive Hack Harassment Battery Packs!
Indico will be awarding the following prizes to the top 3 teams that make the best use of Indico's machine learning API:
Martello Technologies will be awarding prizes to the top two winners of their challenge:
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: The Coolest Visualization of a Simulated Home Network

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: .Tech Domain will be awarding Amazon vouchers to each member of the team with the best website/hack submitted on a .tech domain.

Using a Content Management System (Wordpress, Drupal or Joomla) and HTML/CSS/PHP, the objective is to implement a simple resume processing system. Detailed instructions of the challenge will be on the CUHacking website. Winners will receive interviews for either part-time or potentially full-time jobs at the Global Cybersecurity Resource program.

How might we encourage patients to maintain diet and nutrition plans given by their healthcare provider? Prizes will include TRNDlabs SKEYE Mini Drones with HD camera for each member of the winning team.

hackathon-location-google-maps: https://maps.google.com/?q=1125 Colonel By Dr, Ottawa, ON K1S, Canada

hackathon-judging-criteria.judging-criterion: How innovative or unique is the project?
Does the project solve a problem? Does it benefit society in any way?
How complex is the project? Were external APIs or libraries used? Were the algorithms designed by the team members themselves? Does it incorporate multiple concepts and tools?
Does the project work as intended? How bug-free is it?

hackathon-location-address: 1125 Colonel By Dr, Ottawa, ON K1S, Canada
